alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 3:04PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lafayette, southwestern Union and southern Columbia Counties, Webster, Union, Ouachita, Caddo, northern Jackson, Claiborne, northeastern Bienville, Bossier, Lincoln Parishes in north central Louisiana and eastern Marion Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 304 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alto to 14 miles southeast of Ruston to near Gibsland to near Fosters to near Greenwood. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Monroe, Ruston, Claiborne, Minden, West Monroe, Springhill, Grambling, Homer, Junction City, Swartz, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Farmerville, Vivian, Richwood, Greenwood, Arcadia and Blanchard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
